text: The Fertile Wife of Yahweh
“Sing for joy, barren \add woman\add*; \add who\add* has not borne!
Burst forth \add into\add* rejoicing and rejoice, \add she who\add* has not been in labor!
For \add the\add* children of \add the\add* desolate woman \add are\add* more than \add the\add* children of \add the\add* married woman,” says Yahweh.
“Enlarge the site of your tent,
and let them stretch out the tent curtains of your dwelling place.
You must not spare; make your tent cords long
and strengthen your pegs,
for you will spread out \add to the\add* right and \add to the\add* left.
And your descendants\f + \fr 54:3 \ft Hebrew “descendant” \f* will be heir \add to the\add* nations,
and they will inhabit desolate towns.
You must not fear, for you will not be ashamed,
and you must not be confounded, for you will not feel abashed,
for you will forget the shame of your youth,
and you will no longer remember the disgrace of your widowhood.
For your husband\f + \fr 54:5 \ft The Hebrew is plural \f* \add is\add* your maker,\f + \fr 54:5 \ft The Hebrew is plural \f* his name \add is\add* Yahweh of hosts;
and your redeemer \add is\add* the holy one of Israel, he is called the God of all of the earth.
For Yahweh has called you like a wife forsaken and hurt of spirit,
like\f + \fr 54:6 \ft Or “and” \f* \add the\add* wife of childhood when she is rejected, says your God.
I abandoned you ⸤for a short⸥\f + \fr 54:7 \ft Literally “in a small” \f* moment,
but\f + \fr 54:7 \ft Or “and” \f* I will gather you with great compassion.
I hid my face from you \add for\add* a moment, in the flowing of anger,
but\f + \fr 54:8 \ft Or “and” \f* I will have compassion on you with everlasting faithfulness” says your redeemer, Yahweh.
“For this \add is like\add* the waters of Noah to me,
when I swore ⸤that the waters of Noah would never again pass⸥\f + \fr 54:9 \ft Literally “from the passing over of the waters of Noah again” \f* over the earth,
so I swore ⸤that I would not be⸥\f + \fr 54:9 \ft Literally “from being “ \f* angry at you and rebuke you.
For the mountains may depart,
and the hills may sway,
but\f + \fr 54:10 \ft Or “and” \f* my faithfulness shall not depart from you,
and my covenant of peace shall not sway,”
says Yahweh, who has compassion on you,
“O afflicted \add one\add*, driven away, \add who\add* is not consoled.
Look! I \add am\add* about to set your stones in hard mortar,
and I will lay your foundation with sapphires.
And I will ⸤make⸥\f + \fr 54:12 \ft Literally “place” \f* your battlements of ruby,
and your gates of stones of beryl,
and all your wall of precious stones.
And all your children \add shall be\add* pupils of Yahweh,
and the peace of your children \add shall be\add* great.
In righteousness you shall be established.
Be far from oppression, for you shall not fear,
and from terror, for it shall not come near you.
If indeed one attacks, \add it is\add* not from me;
whoever attacks you shall fall because of you.
Look! I myself have created \add the\add* craftsman who blows\f + \fr 54:16 \ft Or “blowing” \f* \add the\add* fire \add of\add* coals,
and who produces\f + \fr 54:16 \ft Or “producing” \f* a weapon for his work;
also\f + \fr 54:16 \ft Or “and” \f* I myself have created \add the\add* destroyer to destroy.
Every weapon formed against you shall not succeed,
and you shall declare guilty every tongue \add that\add* rises against you for judgment.
This \add is\add* the inheritance of the servants of Yahweh,
and their ⸤legal right⸥\f + \fr 54:17 \ft Literally “justice” \f* from me,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 54:17 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
